column2: You can customize the display label for editor tabs and the Open editors view by adding entries under the workbench.editor.customLabels.patterns setting, which includes a glob pattern that matches file paths and a template that defines the new name for the editor tab.
Locked scrolling feature allows you to compare editors side-by-side with synchronized scrolling.
Extension update improvements include the ability to restart extensions without reload and update extensions with VS Code releases.
Test Coverage API feature provides native code coverage support in VS Code.
Python auto-detect improvements include detecting startup files for Flask & Django, and discovering Hatch environments.
Use the `workbench.editor.customLabels.enabled` setting to enable or disable custom labels.
The **View: Toggle Locked Scrolling Across Editors** command synchronizes scrolling across all visible editors.
Change the `workbench.activityBar.location` setting to `bottom` to move the Activity Bar to the bottom.
Configure the `search.searchEditor.singleClickBehaviour` setting to determine what happens when you single-click on a Search Editor entry.
In Quick Search, file name separators are now sticky to make it clearer which file a search result is associated with.
The keybinding for previewing edits for the Rename Symbols refactoring is now `kb(refactorPreview.apply)` (previously `Shift + Enter`).
The diff editor now has a separate gutter for Stage and Revert controls, which can be used to stage or revert selected changes.
File decorations for incoming changes are now shown in the Source Control section for files that have incoming changes and which were fetched but not yet merged/rebased.
Shell integration is now automatically enabled in terminals that are launched when debugging.
The Open detected link command now previews the link result in the editor and highlights the link source in the terminal.
The Test Coverage API is a new feature that brings native coverage support to VS Code. It allows developers to get coverage if their testing system supports it.
The Run With Coverage button is a new feature that lets developers run tests with coverage in the Test explorer view.

There are new keybindings for running with coverage, such as `kbstyle(Ctrl+; Ctrl+Shift+A)` to run all tests with coverage, and `kbstyle(Ctrl+; Ctrl+Shift+L)` to run the last set of tests with coverage.
VS Code now includes TypeScript 5.4, which brings new improvements to type-checking and IntelliSense, as well as several bug fixes.

We now support standard keyboard shortcuts in notebook outputs, such as selecting and copying output, scrolling output, and selecting output from the current selection point to the top or bottom of the output.
Notebook outline filter controls allow you to customize the view of your notebook outline.
Enabling the 'interactiveWindow.promptToSaveOnClose' setting prompts you to save changes in an Interactive Window when it is closed.
The terminal Inline Chat uses the `@terminal` chat participant, which has context about the integrated terminal's shell and its contents.

The **Learn more** button takes you to our [documentation on authentication requirements](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-release/blob/a032cf75104a99ca745118ca51ea77219441a898/docs/copilot-repo-scope.md).
The **Used references** section in a chat response gives information about the context that is used.
In the Chat view, the chat submit button now has a dropdown for easy access to more actions.
Creating launch configurations for Flask and Django apps just got easier! Improvements have been made to detect possible startup files in your workspace.
GitHub Pull Requests extension shows outdated comments differently from current comments in the Comments view.
With the latest Pylance prerelease, there are better dependency analysis for Jupyter cells.
Extensions can contribute a command for issue reporting in the **Help: Report Issue...** command.
A new setting, **terminal.integrated.rescaleOverlappingGlyphs**, is available to resize glyphs that overlap with following cells.
A preview feature allows packaging an extension directly in the workspace for tailored development experience.

The `Terminal.shellIntegration.executeCommand` proposal allows executing a command in a terminal immediately after creation and listening to the incoming data and exit codes of commands being executed in the terminal.
The proposed `LearnMore` property in `AuthenticationForceNewSessionOptions` enables specifying a URI to be presented to the user to learn more about why authentication is needed.
The new `applicability` property in comment thread allows comment threads to be marked as outdated in the Comments view.
The `commentsView/commentThread/context` proposed menu enables adding actions to the right-click context menu of a comment thread in the Comments view.
The Electron 28 update with Chromium 120.0.6099.291 and Node.js 18.18.2 has been promoted to users on the stable release.
The pull request 198164 by 333fred suggests not to trim whitespace when part of strings or regexes in Visual Studio Code.
A devcontainer.json file in your project tells Visual Studio Code how to access or create a development container with a well-defined tool and runtime stack.
Implemented separate colors for primary and secondary cursors when multiple cursors are present in Visual Studio Code through pull request 181991 by akbyrd.

Fixes for terminal suggestions in Visual Studio Code include sorting by fuzzy score, not showing terminal suggestions when keybindings are sent through to shell, and making the suggest widget persist on completion acceptance through pull requests 208486, 208523, and 208524 by cpendery.
Inline edit - make sure we cancel in-progress request on blur in Visual Studio Code, addressed in pull request 206430 by Krzysztof-Cieslak.
Krzysztof Cieślak fixed an off-by-one error in rendering removals in inline edits in PR #205890.

column1: Make sure we cancel in-progress request on blur in PR #206430
column2: Krzysztof Cieślak made sure that inline edit requests are cancelled on blur in PR #206430.

column1: Add partial accept kind to inline completion handle in PR #202668
column2: Marcus Revaj added a partial accept kind to inline completion handling in PR #202668.

column1: Fix broken description of editor.cursorSurroundingLinesStyle setting in PR #201482
column2: Kyosuke Fujimoto fixed the broken description of the `editor.cursorSurroundingLinesStyle` setting in PR #201482.

column1: Honor GitHub brand name casing in PR #208503
column2: solimant ensured proper casing for GitHub brand names in PR #208503.
A pull request (PR #367) was made to `vscode-css-languageservice` to support hover tooltip for SCSS by Balaji Sivasakthi.
Josh Goldberg added support for JSON, JSON5, and JSONC in eslint.probe setting in `vscode-eslint` (PR #1787).
Julian Kasimir made a pull request (PR #983) to replace German with English in the `showQuickPick` function in `vscode-extension-samples`.
Beanyy fixed the formatting of number 0 in remote object when description is not set in `vscode-js-debug` (PR #1968).
Maria José Solano suggested a specification for MarkupContent support in diagnostic messages in `language-server-protocol` (PR #1905).
